intro: Phillyrea subangustifolia subsp. microdonta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Phillyrea, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, spherical berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
